intro: Oldenlandia pilulifera, commonly known as the bead-leaf or pill-leaf plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, bead-like leaves that are often clustered at the base of the plant. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in umbels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. Oldenlandia pilulifera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
